title: Contributing to fitbitr
text: outlines propose change fitbitr. detailed info contributing , tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide.

title: Contributing to fitbitr
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to fitbitr
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to fitbitr
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("mrkaye97/fitbitr", fork = TRUE). Install development dependences devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to fitbitr
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to fitbitr
text: Please note fitbitr project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Matt Kaye. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kaye M (2023). fitbitr: Interface 'Fitbit' API. https://github.com/mrkaye97/fitbitr, https://matthewrkaye.com/fitbitr/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {fitbitr: Interface with the 'Fitbit' API},   author = {Matt Kaye},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/mrkaye97/fitbitr, https://matthewrkaye.com/fitbitr/}, }

title: Interface with the Fitbit API
text: fitbitr makes easy interface Fitbit data R.

title: Interface with the Fitbit API
text: can install CRAN version fitbitr : can install latest development version Github:
code: install.packages("fitbitr") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("mrkaye97/fitbitr")

title: Interface with the Fitbit API
text: steps ’ll need can start pulling Fitbit data: Make app . Fill fields like (see image guidance).  ’ll redirected page credentials. Make sure keep Client ID, Client Secret, Redirect URL. ’ll need finish setup process. can always refer back apps page find . Generate token: want edit scopes enabled, can scopes = c('scopes', '', 'want', 'enabled') argument. can find information available scope options . want cache token, can specifying either cache = TRUE cache = <-file-path>. See docs httr::oauth2.0_token() details. ’s ! now Fitbit API credentials set . fitbitr tracks behind scenes , need start R session generate_token(). session restart, generate_token() try laod token .httr-oauth exists.
code: library(fitbitr)  .fitbitr_token <- generate_oauth_token(   oauth_app_name = <YOUR-APP-NAME>,   client_id = <YOUR-CLIENT-ID>,   client_secret = <YOUR-CLIENT-SECRET>   callback = <YOUR-REDIRECT-URL> )

title: Interface with the Fitbit API
text: token, using fitbitr straightforward: fitbitr tries return useful, tidy object back API.

title: Interface with the Fitbit API
text: Given structure Fitbit API, doesn’t appear currently possible use fitbitr outside interactive session. furthermore, doesn’t help Fitbit refresh tokens last 8 hours, point ’d need another interactive session generate new one. reasons, advised try use fitbitr non-interactively, Shiny app server, CI/CD process, background job, etc.

title: Generate an Oauth token — generate_fitbitr_token
text: Performs OAuth 2.0 dance create token use Fitbit API.

title: Generate an Oauth token — generate_fitbitr_token
code: generate_fitbitr_token(   app_name = "fitbitr",   client_id = Sys.getenv("FITBIT_CLIENT_ID"),   client_secret = Sys.getenv("FITBIT_CLIENT_SECRET"),   callback = Sys.getenv("FITBIT_CALLBACK", "https://localhost:1410/"),   scope = c("activity", "cardio_fitness", "electrocardiogram", "heartrate", "location",     "nutrition", "oxygen_saturation", "profile", "respiratory_rate", "settings", "sleep",     "social", "temperature", "weight"),   cache = TRUE,   use_basic_auth = TRUE,   ... )

title: Generate an Oauth token — generate_fitbitr_token
text: app_name name OAuth app. Default: fitbitr client_id Fitbit client ID client_secret Fitbit client secret callback Fitbit redirect URL scope scopes enable cache want cache token? See oauth2.0_token details use_basic_auth boolean whether use basic auth oauth2.0_token. Defaults TRUE ... additional arguments passed oauth2.0_token

title: Generate an Oauth token — generate_fitbitr_token
text: Returns OAuth 2.0 token (invisibly) can used authorize requests Fitbit API. Also saves token .fitbitr_token.

title: Generate an Oauth token — generate_fitbitr_token
text: Saves token .fitbitr_token can used background authorize requests

title: Perform a GET request — perform_get
text: Perform GET request

title: Perform a GET request — perform_get
code: perform_get(url, ...)

title: Perform a GET request — perform_get
text: url URL make request ... Additional arguments (currently used)

title: Perform a GET request — perform_get
text: response

what: Get intraday active zone minutes time series — get_active_zone_minutes_intraday
title: Get intraday active zone minutes time series — get_active_zone_minutes_intraday
text: See API documentation detailed explanations parameters usage information examples.

title: Get intraday active zone minutes time series — get_active_zone_minutes_intraday
code: get_active_zone_minutes_intraday(   date = lubridate::today(),   detail_level = c("1min", "5min", "15min"),   start_time = NULL,   end_time = NULL )

title: Get intraday active zone minutes time series — get_active_zone_minutes_intraday
text: date date get data detail_level detail level. One "1min", "5min", "15min" start_time start time time window. Default: NULL gets whole day end_time end time time window. Default: NULL gets whole day

title: Get intraday active zone minutes time series — get_active_zone_minutes_intraday
code: if (FALSE) { date <- lubridate::today()  ## get minute by minute data get_active_zone_minutes_intraday(detail_level = "15min")  ## get more granular data get_active_zone_minutes_intraday(detail_level = "1min") }

title: Activity Calories Time Series — get_activity_calories
text: Resource path /activities/activityCalories

title: Activity Calories Time Series — get_activity_calories
code: get_activity_calories(start_date, end_date)

title: Activity Calories Time Series — get_activity_calories
text: start_date start date records returned "yyyy-mm-dd" date(time) format end_date end date records returned "yyyy-mm-dd" date(time) format

title: Activity Calories Time Series — get_activity_calories
text: tibble two columns: date activity_calories

title: Activity Calories Time Series — get_activity_calories
code: if (FALSE) { start_date <- lubridate::today() - lubridate::weeks(1) end_date <- lubridate::today() get_activity_calories(date) }

title: Activity Summary — get_activity_summary

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: See magrittr::%>% details.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
code: lhs %>% rhs

text: lhs value magrittr placeholder. rhs function call using magrittr semantics.

title: fitbitr 0.3.0
text: v0.3.0 significant overhaul fitbitr

title: fitbitr 0.3.0
text: Functions now verb-prefixed, steps become get_steps()

title: fitbitr 0.3.0
text: Significantly validation exists function arguments sending requests API information returned user API errors Adds new intraday time series Many updates internals Significant additional test coverage overhauls tests run.

title: fitbitr 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-08-22 Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Fixed couple bugs token generation works Added opinionated types columns responses Improved error handling

title: fitbitr 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-06-07 Initial version fitbitr
